title: 🌅 Why offer water to the Sun?
text: Ancient Ayurveda meets modern science: Morning sun exposure helps regulate circadian rhythm, while water offering creates mindful gratitude practice.

title: 🕉️ What does OM really mean?
text: A-U-M represents creation, preservation, and destruction. The silence after represents the infinite. Modern physics confirms sound's creative power.

title: 🪔 Why light lamps at dusk?
text: Diya lighting at Sandhya (twilight) symbolizes dispelling ignorance. The ritual also maintains vitamin D balance as daylight fades.

title: 🌿 The science of Tulsi worship
text: Holy Basil releases oxygen 20 hours daily and purifies air. Ancient texts knew what modern science confirms - it's nature's air purifier.

title: 🙏 Why join palms in Namaste?
text: Pressing palms activates pressure points, calms the mind, and shows respect. The gesture means 'the divine in me honors the divine in you.'

title: 🔔 Temple bells and their purpose
text: Bell sound clears the mind and announces your arrival to the divine. The specific frequency (50-60 Hz) synchronizes brain hemispheres.

title: 🌺 Why flowers in worship?
text: Flowers represent the impermanence of beauty and life. Their fragrance purifies the environment while colors stimulate positive emotions.

title: 🧘 The power of meditation postures
text: Padmasana (lotus pose) optimizes blood flow to the brain and spine. Ancient yogis discovered what neuroscience now proves about posture and focus.

title: 🌙 Fasting on Ekadashi explained
text: Lunar cycles affect body water (70% of us). Ekadashi fasting aligns with moon's gravitational pull, aiding digestion and mental clarity.

title: 🐄 Why cows are considered sacred?
text: Cows provide milk, dung (fuel/fertilizer), and urine (antiseptic). Ancient economy depended on them - hence the reverence and protection.
